meanings.definition: The act or process of changing from one system, method, or situation to another.
meanings.sent1: The changeover from summer to fall brought cooler weather.
meanings.sent2: The changeover of seasons happens four times a year.
meanings.sent3: During the changeover to online classes, the students had to adapt quickly.
meanings.sent4: The changeover in leadership led to a new direction for the company.
meanings.sent5: The changeover of power was smooth and efficient.

meanings.definition: A shift or transition from one state or condition to another.
meanings.sent1: The changeover from day to night was gradual.
meanings.sent2: The changeover of emotions was evident on her face.
meanings.sent3: The changeover from laughter to tears happened in an instant.
meanings.sent4: The changeover in mood affected the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The changeover in weather brought unexpected storms.
